comments.body: What problems do you have with it, excactly?

problems i have with it

  • telling millions of people they require a Microsoft account now
  • data collecting since not everyone has a account it will give Microsoft more accounts
  • the only reason the Migration is because of 2FA instead of making 2FA they just forced millions to change over..
  • instead of just hacking a account for the character to cheat they can collect people's data

    which means if people start using Microsoft more often and don't turn on 2FA, it just means more people information can be stolen and sold online from teens to kids

    that's the biggest issue for me, it's a big security problem
yes i agree! There is NO absolute reason to change accounts. Good ol mojang accounts are just fine.

This migration kinda sucks because i bought Minecraft Java a year ago and i have been playing it just fine. But after i did the migration, while i wss trying to log in to servers like Hypixel or other servers it says ‚ÄúFailed to login:null‚Äù.I was really angry because i cant play Minecraft now
Why don‚Äôt you just call Minecraft support, so they can help you?

Why is the change necessary? and Why in the WORLD would you disable non Microsoft accounts?! A big part of the growth of Minecraft is thru the community and the plugins and mods that people have created over the years for the Minecraft we know and love today! If you disable the use of the java accounts, all the launchers tied to the java launcher will be null and void and all that work, time, and effort people put into those creations will be for nothing. 
You say it's for better security, and better launcher but the launcher has been so buggy since the change, and their was a bug that made it so hackers could get control of accounts thru the launcher from any server on the 1.18 Minecraft update so I doubt the migrate to the "new and improved" launcher is all that great after all.

I agree, it definitely should not be required.

It's a pretty big security issue for one. There are a lot of things tied to a Microsoft account, especially if you do any .NET development, and getting it compromised is a much bigger problem than getting a Mojang account compromised.

It's also an issue for people with multiple Mojang accounts since they apparently only allow one to be linked to a Microsoft account. We have several that we use for a convention that we now have no idea how to handle.

i agree with this post a lot. mojang should just let non-microsoft account user stay the way they are instead of forcing them to switch over. and i also especially agree with this because i  cant even switch over because my email adress was deleted before i could change it which leads to me losing i game i love very much because then i cant play without a microsoft acount.so mojang, please change it back to normal this really was a stupid idea.

I am now locked out of my own minecraft legacy account, because I am stuck in the migration process. When trying to validate the e-mail address, it keeps telling me the e-mail I entered is invalid. I can't change the e-mail or otherwise do anything about it, because I do not have the transaciton ID. 
I got minecraft way back in 2011, it is unreasonable of microsoft to require someone to still have such information saved 10+ years after the game was bought, in order to still play the game.
The help center haven't been able to help at all.

Microsoft, fix this. I am not rebuying minecraft just because you're being unreasonable.
for me it now wants me to migrate or delete the account info. good riddance, i'll be off building my own game with blackjack and hooks

How can it even be legal to force users to migrate to Microsoft accounts!? I bought and paid for the game years before Microsoft took over, and now you just decided to prevent me from playing MY copy of the game!! Unless, offcourse, I migrate to Microsoft - and incidentally thereby surrender loads of more or less personal data to you,

Offcourse, having access to lots of data about as many users as possible is not at all your goal with the migration, right!? Instead you claim to do it only to increase security for the users. But... I neither need nor want that added security! I don't play online, I've never had any issues with the Mojang account, and in fact I'd prefer to play offline and not use any account at all. But no... YOU now prevent ME from playing MY game. If you're that keen on serving your users, then you would at least have made the migration optional! 

It pisses me even more of, that it's not even possible to leave a comment or complaint about it here, without (tadaaa) getting a Microsoft account. And when I logged on to feedback.minecraft.net / this site, I even had to accept, that the app got access to my Xbox account info and the mail adresses of my profile. Highly relevant to ensuring my Minecraft account security... hmm!! 

Again... you prevent me from playing my copy of the game!! What on earth gives you the rigth to do that?
I've migrated my account, twice at this point, and still lost access to MC. Why in the world would I have to buy a game that I have already bought before...

I want my account back. I never even knew that my account was going to be deleted. It also feels like I have been legally robbed by Microsoft. Why do you treat costumers this way? I am sorry that I am not all knowing and am aware of all the happenings at Microsoft and Minecraft HQ. 

Congrats you have added another person to the "Minecraft sucks" category by doing this as well as now I will purposely avoid Microsoft products as well in response to this. Why would I ever want to buy a software that a company can take away from me cause it just "feels like it".
I am disappointed in both Minecraft and Microsoft and will probably not be using them from now on if I can help it.
YES, I have the same problem, and it is so annoying pls fix it.
Plz fix

Yes, please yes! This is so annoying and no one wants to have to go out of their way just to download a whole new launcher. If Mojang (or Microsoft?) would add a setting in "General" under maybe "Launcher Accessibility Settings" for microphone permission or just ask upon launching, this would help a lot.

please for the love of god, I hate to have to choose my monitor by selecting my main display then lunching the game and then going back to my main. also adding a Field of View for wide and ultra-wide monitors as the characters look blurry otherwise especially in the character selection.
This could be cool as a second screen could show what server you're on, your FPS, the entire F3 screen, and more stuff that you would have to use a modpack to show otherwise (ex. Lunar Client)

You can already have multiple accounts in the launcher and switch between them without signing out. Click on "Settings" and go to "Accounts". You can there add more accounts to the launcher. If you have more than one account, you can switch them by clicking on your profile in the top left. This has been a feature forever.
I agree. With the new launcher update, it will not allow you to have multiple Microsoft accounts like it does on the last version of the launcher
Please, Mojang. I'm begging you. Going through the entire process is tedious as hell. Just add a quick switch button like before.
it used to be as easy as a switch account button and then click the other account in the launcher, but now with the migration, you can't quick switch Microsoft accounts

I would take it a step further and allow account switching in-game from the menu. In a shared computer situation that requires a lot of account switching, having to completely close and reopen the game each time can painful.

In case this helps isolate the issue, when I go to use the supposed "add account" feature, it asks me to login with my alt accounts Microsoft login (different than my primary - different emails entirely) it then seemingly logs me out of my current Account. Not actually "Adding" anything, but requiring me to switch entirely.
JUST FIX IT CAN'T LOG IN 0407JCAR

Minecraft Pocket Edition should have started development way back in 2009. Then Minecraft Bedrock would have its 15th anniversary in May 2024 for parity with Java.
I was really hoping there would at least be some regional servers, or something.

I used to think bedrock is better, but since when i got java for my christmas present, it became my favorite game(and version).

all they have to do with the GUI and camera areas in the aquarium is make a mod for Java? they could even add the Party addon that was ALSO bedrock exclusive to their official mod!
Like in the old launcher you could press a button that would open up the installation's directory, I think we should have a directory button rather than the resource pack button, but either is ok.

As Someone who is working with resource packs a lot, this would be an amazing thing to add, and it would be even more amazing if there was one for the worlds folder, so you could insert worlds into your game from the launcher before you run minecraft.

Indeed, it wouldn't be beneficial, shall I drop the Android and openjdk parts off the list? I rearranged the post anyway. Besides emulation does the job for most devices. This leaves ARM Linux devices unsupported though.
I just came into launcher looking for this. I really want new support for m1 so minecraft will be blazing fast when i get a new mac.

It is possible to use the minecraft launcher with a chrome os device

but you would need a device that support linux

To my understandings, it's not possible to run Minecraft either on a chrome OS ARM nor Linux ARM device. Windows ARM and Mac ARM emulation performance must be horrible. With the new lwjgl Mac OS x86 performance is also a lot faster and Vulkan enhances the other platforms as well.

I was talking about this myself. With the old Java launcher, Raspberry Pi users were able to login with a Mojang account and play as soon as the version they wanted was done downloading. The only thing preventing people from doing that right now is the fact that the accounts are being migrated to Microsoft accounts, and I suspect that this has been coming for a long time, probably since the rollout of the new launcher style back in 2016.

But in the event that Microsoft decides not to go through with any of this, I'll start talking 3rd-party launchers:

If you could integrate the ARM/aarch64 build of LWJGL into MultiMC and rebuild MultiMC for ARM/aarch64, you could probably get it working. While MultiMC is 3rd-party, it still requires auth, so it's still a legitimate launcher that requires purchase of the game. I mention this here because Microsoft might see it and want to fight the people who made the launcher. I don't condone taking them down, they aren't affecting the bottom line.
Yes please. There are already existing solutions to run Minecraft on ARM natively, so it should not be any problem for minecraft devs
when arm devices play minecraft  java servers could be more full and do not need anther pc to play
PLEASE!!!
PLEASE

if that's the case, they could just make a separate saves folder.

please do add them back mojang

All they had to do was update the grass block to the new textures from 1.14. but I agree, some flat texture doesn't help it stand out from all the shortcuts on my desktop.

100% Agreed. I don't think the Mojang team over at Microsoft are really listening to any of its user base after a dozen of the same complaints and feedback posted on here, it should be painfully obvious by now that what they did was and still is 100% wrong. They keep making so many changes that are so totally unnecessary and uncalled for.

It wouldn't surprise me if they just mysteriously take out actual creepers from the game itself out of a complete whim (or changing the creeper skin colour to red for no other apparent reason except for the mantra of "change").

My suggestion would be to update the launcher .exe file to include the various icons from past and present versions so we can choose which icon we like best to represent Minecraft on our desktops. I seriously do NOT like the creeper icon (creepers trigger a minor PTSD-like reaction), and I've been forced to replace the current default desktop launcher icon with a stupid generic Microsoft icon. In my humble opinion, nothing was more iconic than the grass block, which practically screams MINECRAFT!  While the developers may have gotten tired of seeing the same icon, some of us users are quite attached to it.  We should have that choice to keep our historic icon, or accept the new default one, by including other [past] icons in the .exe file for us to choose from in the launcher's properties.  If not included in the launcher .exe file, please have the updater download an .ico file into the launcher directory for us to choose other icons from.
i like the new one
Maybe it should be an option.
Sometimes there is no need to make something "better", because its old. It's not, and it is not even better.
agreed microsoft even dose ruin 99% of minecraft things
